meanings.definition: The quality of being sneaky or deceitful.
meanings.sent1: Her sneakiness was evident when she tried to take credit for my work.
meanings.sent2: I could see his sneakiness in the way he avoided eye contact.
meanings.sent3: The cat's sneakiness in stealing treats from the jar was both impressive and annoying.
meanings.sent4: The politician's sneakiness in twisting the truth was like a shadow lurking in the background.
meanings.sent5: The sneakiness of the spy was so well-practiced that no one suspected a thing.

meanings.definition: The act of behaving in a sly or underhanded manner.
meanings.sent1: His sneakiness in cheating during the game was quickly noticed by the referee.
meanings.sent2: The sneakiness of the fox as it stole eggs from the henhouse was legendary.
meanings.sent3: The children's sneakiness in planning a surprise party for their parents was heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: The sneakiness of the thief was like a silent whisper in the night.
meanings.sent5: The sneakiness of the detective helped solve the mystery in record time.
